climbs.name: Hangman Jury
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer, Dave Stoner and Louie Anderson, February 1990

content.description: The crux comes early on and involves pulling a hard move on crisp, thin edges. Once past the horizontal crack the angle relents, the holds become huge and the bolts become more spaced until the anchor is reached.  An excellent route with fun movement and good rock that affords great vistas down into Dodge City Canyon and the surrounding area. Plan on a thiry or so minute approach, which although reasonable seems to be a factor in keeping the crowds down. Three stars out of five.
content.location:
Around and left from

Frontier Justice

and facing towards the Ponderosa Wall is this northeast-facing route which ascends a triangular block split by a horizontal crack at mid-height.

climbs.name: Frontier Justice
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer and Alan Bartlett, October 1990

content.description:
A hand crack start leads up to an imposing roof (5.10+) which goes at a far easier grade than appearances suggest. Once established over the lip the climbing is off-vertical, thin face with difficult smearing. The crux will be found around the vicinity of the fifth bolt with easier moves leading to the top and a bolted anchor/rap.

This spectacular route is well worth the rugged thirty minute approach. Almost a sport climb, except for the crack start, but the rest of the route is protected like one. Four stars out of five for enjoyable positioning and the high-quality moves.

This photogenic route was featured on the front and back cover of Alan Bartlett's "Rock Climbs of Indian Cove" guidebook (1st edition).
content.location: Located on a northerly-facing block that faces towards the left side of the Corral Wall, this climb is shady most of the day. If approaching from the vicinity of the Corral Wall it helps to stay high and to the right in the boulders on the approach.
